edge: Director Wych Kaosayananda, also known as 'Kaos', directed the 2002 science fiction action thriller film Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever.
In Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever, Antonio Banderas and Lucy Liu played opposing secret agents who teamed up to fight a common enemy.
The 2002 science fiction action thriller film Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever had a production budget of $70 million.
Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever grossed $20.2 million at the box-office.
The 2002 science fiction action thriller film Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever was universally panned by critics.
The 2002 science fiction action thriller film Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever has a total of 119 reviews on Rotten Tomatoes, making it the worst-reviewed film in their history.
In Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever, Antonio Banderas and Lucy Liu played opposing secret agents who teamed up to fight a common enemy.
Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever is a 2002 science fiction action thriller film.
Michael Gant had Softkill implanted in him by his father, Robert Gant, in order to smuggle it into the United States.
Robert Gant stole Softkill and implanted it in his son, Michael Gant, for the purpose of smuggling it into the United States.
Sever kidnapped Michael Gant while he and his mother were returning home from a trip to Berlin.
Sever nearly wiped out Michael Gant's DIA security detail during the kidnapping.
Jeremiah Ecks left the FBI after his wife Rayne was killed in a car bombing.
Julio Martin is Jeremiah Ecks' old boss at the FBI.
Sever is an orphaned Chinese girl adopted by the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) to train as a covert operative and assassin.

node_2: survivor of michael gant's security detail
edge: After nearly wiping out Michael Gant's security detail during the kidnapping, Sever shot and killed the only survivor at the orders of Robert Gant.
FBI agent Jeremiah Ecks is asked by Vin, Michael Gant's mother, to investigate the kidnapping of her son in exchange for information on his whereabouts.
Robert Gant ordered A. J. Ross and his elite DIA agents to pursue Sever and rescue Michael Gant.
Ecks is arrested by the Vancouver Police Department under the false pretense that he killed Martin.
While being transported to jail, Sever frees Ecks after attacking his convoy.
Rayne married Gant under the name Vinn.
Ecks and Rayne meet at an aquarium, and it's revealed that her 'death' was orchestrated by Gant.
Sever kidnaps Michael for his protection.
Gant and Ross arrive with an army of heavily armed DIA agents.
Sever kills Ross in a fight in the bunker.
Gant tries to retrieve the Softkill in Michael's arm but is surprised to find it's not there.
Sever kills Gant using a Softkill-loaded bullet.
In 1986, screenwriter Alan B. McElroy wrote a spec script titled Legion, about an ex L.A. cop who's called in to help track down a rogue CIA agent code-named Legion who went on a killing spree.

After he and director Dwight H. Little made Halloween 4: The Return of Michael Myers (1988), the next movie they wanted to do was Legion, which by then was re-titled into Gunner, the name of the main hero character in the script.

Between 1988 and 1989 they worked on the project at Vestron Pictures, and Dolph Lundgren was going to star in the film, however, due to management changes in Vestron, producer Charles W. Fries stopped the development of the film.
The script was left unproduced until about 1999 when it was picked up for production again, but this time with the new title, Ecks vs. Sever.
Chris Lee announced production of Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever on November 12, 1999, in The Honolulu Advertiser.
Franchise Pictures produced Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever, as announced by The Honolulu Advertiser on November 12, 1999.
Kaosaynanda directed Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever, as announced by The Honolulu Advertiser on November 12, 1999.
Originally intended to star Wesley Snipes in Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever.
Originally intended to star Jet Li in Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever.
After Wesley Snipes and Jet Li, Sylvester Stallone was going to star in Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever.
After Wesley Snipes and Jet Li, Vin Diesel was going to star in Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever.
Kaosaynanda's preferred choices for Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever were Chow Yun-fat and Jean Reno, but producers didn't consider them financially viable.
Kaosaynanda's preferred choices for Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever were Chow Yun-fat and Jean Reno, but producers didn't consider them financially viable.
Lucas Liu was in discussions about starring in Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever, as revealed by Entertainment Weekly on July 26, 2001.
Antonio Banderas was in discussions about starring in Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever, as revealed by Entertainment Weekly on July 26, 2001.
Lee changed the filming location for Ballistic from Bangkok to Vancouver due to lower production costs and superior tax incentives.
Lee advocated for more government funding for Hawaii's film industry during the filming of Ballistic, appearing at the event Hawaii's Film Industry: Global Impact, Global Challenges.
All of the pyrotechnics shown in Ballistic were produced using real explosions rather than computer-generated graphics.
In a 2024 interview, Kaosayananda claimed that the actual production budget of Ballistic was $35 million, half of the officially-reported $70 million.
Producer Franchise Pictures was known to fraudulently inflate the budgets of their films, most notably Battlefield Earth, as found by a Los Angeles Superior Court in 2004.

node_2: worst-reviewed movie in our site's history
edge: ranked number 1 on its 'The Worst of the Worst' movie list
The movie Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever and the video game Ecks vs. Sever, which was released 10 months before the film, are related as they both share the same title, 'Ecks vs. Sever'.
The movie Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever received criticism from Roger Ebert, who called the title 'strange' and noted that renaming it 'Ballistic' would not have solved its problems.
Roger Ebert gave the movie Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever half a star out of four and listed it on his most hated movies list.

node_2: stinkers bad movie awards worst actress award
edge: Lucy Liu was nominated for the Stinkers Bad Movie Awards Worst Actress Award for her performance in Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever, but lost to Madonna's performance in Swept Away.
Director Wych Kaosayananda stated that he had never seen the finished movie Ballistic: Ecks vs. Sever.
